ChordGenerator

Attention

The chord generator used with the option “-e” can take some time as it generates a file quite large (2MB).

Module Summary

Script that generates all chords and their notes.

Imports

os: Import the path functions.

sys: Import the arguments from the command-line.

copy: Import function to deepcopy objects.

json: Import json dumping.

Global variables

generators.chordgenerator.ROOTS: list

List containing all chord roots/tonics.

Functions

make_chromatic_scale(): Makes a chromatic scale.

get_all_intervals_index(): Gets an interval index from a list.

generate_chords(): Generates all chords.

dump_chords_to_json(): Dump chords to disk in .json format.

run(): Runs script.

Classes

Chord: Defines chords and their methods.

ChordNameFormatter: Has methods to format chord names.

TriadChordGenerator: generates triads.

SeventhChordGenerator: generates seventh chords.

ExtendedChordGenerator: generates extended chords.

Functions

generators.chordgenerator.make_chromatic_scale(root: str) → list

Make a chromatic scale based on a given root.

Declares two lists containing the keys that have sharps and flats in their scales, then make a scale with only that type of accident. Last, sets the root of the scale to be the root passed as argument.

Parameters:

root (str) – Root of the scale-to-be.

Variables:

  • sharp_keys (list) – Keys that have sharps in them.

  • flat_keys (list) – Keys that have flats in them.

Returns:

The made chromatic scale.

Return type:

list

generators.chordgenerator.get_all_intervals_index(interv: str) → int

Get an interval’s index from a list with all intervals.

generators.chordgenerator.generate_chords(chord_generator: TriadChordGenerator | SeventhChordGenerator | ExtendedChordGenerator) → dict

Generate all chords of a given type and format them to dump.

First declares an empty dictionary to dump the chords in. Then iterates through ROOTS setting root to the current note, generates all chords of the type of the given generator and the power chords. Finally, formats the name and intervals of the chords to use as keys of the dump and uses the notes as values. In-between root change, clears the chords_generated.

Parameters:

chord_generator (Generator) – The generator to be used.

Returns:

The chord dump variable.

Return type:

dict

generators.chordgenerator.dump_chords_to_json(chord_dump: dict, mode: str, path='../data')

Dumps the generated chords in .json format to disk.

Parameters:

  • chord_dump (dict) – The dump variable containing chord information.

  • mode (str) – The mode used in the script.

  • path (str) – The directory to dump the chords in.

Classes

Chord Summary

class generators.chordgenerator.Chord(name='', intervals={})

Class defining chords and their methods.

Attributes

name: str

The name of the chord (e.g.: “Cm7”).

intervals: set

The intervals of the chord, in a set as to not have duplicates.

notes: str

The notes of the chord, separated by spaces.

Methods

order_intervals(): Return the chord’s intervals in order.

get_chord_notes(): Get the chord’s notes.

add_interval_and_tone(): Increment name and intervals.

get_root(): Get the chord’s root.

__init__(name='', intervals={})

Instantiate a chord.

Passes parameters to name and intervals attributes and declares an empty notes.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Passed to Chord.name.

  • intervals (set) – Passed to Chord.intervals.

Chord Methods

Chord.order_intervals() → list

Sort and return sorted chord intervals.

Declares a list with all intervals in order, then turns the intervals attribute into a list and sort it using the index of the previous list, finally returning it.

Variables:

all_intervals (list) – All intervals in order.

Returns:

The chord’s intervals in order.

Return type:

list

Chord.get_chord_notes()

Get the notes of the chord, ordered by intervals.

First orders the chord’s intervals with order_intervals(), gets the root with get_root() and then makes a chromatic scale with make_chromatic_scale(). Next, iterates through the ordered intervals, getting the index of each one using get_all_intervals_index() and using said index on the chromatic scale to get the corresponding note.

Chord.add_interval_and_tone(interval: str, tone: str)

Increment the chord’s interval set and name.

Chord.get_root() → str

Get the chord’s root.

Check for an accident in the chord’s name and returns the portion corresponding to a root.

Returns:

The root (first note) of the chord.

Return type:

str

ChordNameFormatter Summary

class generators.chordgenerator.ChordNameFormatter

Class that groups methods to format chord names.

Methods

format_triad_name(): Formats triad chord names.

format_seventh_chord_name(): Formats seventh chord names.

format_extended_chord_name(): Formats extended chord names.

ChordNameFormatter Methods

static ChordNameFormatter.format_triad_name(chord: Chord)

Format triad names using replace().

Formats diminished chords to not have “mdim” suffix.

Parameters:

chord (Chord) – Chord to be formatted.

static ChordNameFormatter.format_seventh_chord_name(chord: Chord)

Format seventh chord names using replace().

Formats “(b5)” chords to have the suffix at the end of the name. Formats “sus” chords to have a slash between their suffix and a “7”.

Parameters:

chord (Chord) – Chord to be formatted.

static ChordNameFormatter.format_extended_chord_name(chord: Chord)

Format extended chord names using replace().

Format the chords to either not have a slash or have parenthesis in its place, where applicable.

Parameters:

chord (Chord) – Chord to be formatted.

TriadChordGenerator Summary

class generators.chordgenerator.TriadChordGenerator(root='')

Class that defines a triad generator and its methods.

Attributes

chords_generated: list[Chord]

List of chords generated.

root: str

Note used as root of the chords generated.

Methods

generate_triads(): Generate all triads.

generate_sus_chords(): Generate all “sus” chords.

generate_power_chord(): Generate the power chord of the root.

remove_unstandard_triad_chords(): Remove selected triads.

generate(): Combines all methods and formats the chords.

__init__(root='')

Instantiates a generator.

Passes a parameter to the root to be used as base to the chords_generated, which is initialized as an empty list.

Parameters:

root (str) – Root of the chords to be generated.

TriadChordGenerator Methods

TriadChordGenerator.generate_triads()

Generate all triad chords with the generator’s root.

Declares dictionaries containing thirds and fifths (the components of a triad chord), with both intervals and chord tones, then iterate through them. At the end, instantiate an empty chord and use add_interval_and_tone() to add the elements to it, finally appending it to the chords_generated.

Variables:

  • thirds (dict) – Dictionary containing both thirds.

  • fifths (dict) – Dictionary containing all fifths.

TriadChordGenerator.generate_sus_chords()

Generate all “sus” chords of the generator’s root.

Similar to generate_triads(), declares a dictionary with intervals and chord tones, then iterate through it, adding the elements to the chord in the process.

Variables:

sus_chords_dict (dict) – Contains “sus” chord information.

TriadChordGenerator.generate_power_chord()

Create a power (5) chord and adds it to the list.

TriadChordGenerator.remove_unstandard_triad_chords()

Remove unstandard triads from the list of chords generated.

Copies chords_generated so the removing doesn’t mess up the iteration that ensues. First, remove major chords that have “dim” in their names, then remove minor chords that have augmented particles in them.

TriadChordGenerator.generate()

Combine all generation methods and formats the chords.

Generates triad chords, “sus” chords, removes the unstandard ones, format them and get their notes.

SeventhChordGenerator Summary

class generators.chordgenerator.SeventhChordGenerator(root='')

Child class of TriadChordGenerator for seventh chords.

Methods

generate_seventh_chords(): Generates all seventh chords.

remove_unstandard_seventh_chords(): Removes selected chords.

generate(): Generates, gets notes and format seventh chords.

__init__(root='')

Instantiates a generator.

Passes a parameter to the root to be used as base to the chords_generated, which is initialized as an empty list.

Parameters:

root (str) – Root of the chords to be generated.

SeventhChordGenerator Methods

SeventhChordGenerator.generate_seventh_chords()

Generate all seventh chords using the generator’s root.

Declares a variable containing seventh intervals and tones, then uses the parent class’s TriadChordGenerator.generate() to establish the base chords. Finally, iterates through the chords and the variable and adds its elements to a deepcopy of the chords, appending them to chords_generated.

Variables:

sevenths (dict) – Dictionary containing seventh elements.

SeventhChordGenerator.remove_unstandard_seventh_chords()

Remove chords out of the musical standard.

Iterates through a copy of the list of chords and remove “mmaj7”, “susmaj7”, “augmaj7” and “dim7” chords from the original.

SeventhChordGenerator.generate()

Generate seventh chords, format names and get notes.

ExtendedChordGenerator Summary

class generators.chordgenerator.ExtendedChordGenerator(root='')

Class to generate all extended chords.

Methods

generate_nth_chords(): Adds any given extension to chords.

generate_extended_chords(): Generates all extended chords.

remove_unstandard_extended_chords(): Remove selected chords.

generate(): Combine previous methods and gets chords’ notes.

__init__(root='')

Instantiates a generator.

Passes a parameter to the root to be used as base to the chords_generated, which is initialized as an empty list.

Parameters:

root (str) – Root of the chords to be generated.

ExtendedChordGenerator Methods

ExtendedChordGenerator.generate_nth_chords(extension_dict: dict)

Add to chords a given extension.

Similar to generate_seventh_chords() this method uses iteration and deepcopying, with the addition of a separator between chord tones and the passing of a parameter to choose which extension to use.

Parameters:

extension_dict (dict) – Dictionary containing an extension.

ExtendedChordGenerator.generate_extended_chords()

Generate all extended chords with the generator’s root.

Declares three variables containing the three types of extension and uses first the parent class’s generate() then the generate_nth_chords() method with the variables to generate.

Variables:

  • ninths (dict) – Contains the ninth extensions.

  • elevenths (dict) – Contains the eleventh extensions.

  • thirteenths (dict) – Contains the thirteenth extensions.

ExtendedChordGenerator.remove_unstandard_extended_chords()

Remove chords not up to standards.

Removes “2”, “4”, and “6” chords that aren’t only major.

ExtendedChordGenerator.generate()

Generate extended chords, format names and get notes.
